meanings.definition: A person or thing that annoys.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors are the annoyers in our building.
meanings.sent2: The annoyers at the party kept interrupting conversations.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy turned into a little annoyer when it chewed on everyone's shoes.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was the annoyers' symphony in the summer night.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketer became the ultimate annoyer with their endless calls.

meanings.definition: Those who cause irritation or frustration.
meanings.sent1: The group of loud talkers in the library were the annoyers for everyone trying to study.
meanings.sent2: The annoyers in the office always seemed to create unnecessary drama.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels stealing birdseed from the feeder were the little annoyers of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jams during rush hour were the annoyers of commuters trying to get home.
meanings.sent5: The slow internet connection became the biggest annoyer for the online gamers.
